channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: BTW, when people say there are already too many guns out there to make controlling it be impossible, a lot of shooters, esp really young men, buy their weapon just before going on a spree. https://t.co/fdjtcFN2GF
What would you do right now if you were CEO of Twitter?
@mathewi I watched the video of the Buffalo murderer, and my visceral thought was everyone should see this. There was a reality there that I had never felt. I was witnessing it.
@jeffjarvis Absolutely. I heard that on NPR this morning, it's "Congress" that's standing in the way of controlling use of guns. They also call the NRA a "gun rights" organization.
@jeffjarvis Represent the interest of their readers.

@om @flyosity Om I think I understand why. It takes years to find the sweet stuff that most people want, and by then the developers who know how to work on it are gone. There is an answer, invent and fund a new kind of developer, one who makes a career of one product or one kind of product.

@om @flyosity Iâ€™m a newcomer to music apps, but got a free six months with Amazon music, and it works pretty well, just wish I had more control over offline mode because where I live thereâ€™s no cell coverage. Havenâ€™t tried the others.
Trump endorsements fizzle in Georgia. https://t.co/5ZbTBGNPFw
No one needs a gun that can kill 19 children.
@chipchristian Thatâ€™s exactly the bullshit yâ€™all say.

Amazingly some post-boomers think theyâ€™re the first generation to figure out that â€œthe establishmentâ€ doesnâ€™t work. The truth is sadder. Weâ€™ve known since we came of age, but couldnâ€™t change it.

Wikipedia: Uvalde, Texas. https://t.co/EIteJC9p6N
wow davos isn't all bullshit this year. https://t.co/mmed71GOy0

@AdamSinger @jackcalvinross What I don't like about either is I have to use their writing tools. I don't write for growth of people reading me, I do it because writing is part of my process. I have tools that are customized to my way of thinking, and neither substack or medium come close.
Ex-White House press secretary Jen Psaki hired by MSNBC. https://t.co/5nHpTYDtFN

@futuroviudo I've built up my whole world with packages. Retooling is a huge waste of time. It'd probably be simpler for me to take a couple of months and just implement require in the browser. I can't imagine it's all that hard. I bet someone has done it. ;-)
@jobsworth @AnantRangaswami I can't imagine the pain. Nothing can replace a brother.

In JavaScript: Why can't we have the require verb work in browser-based apps as it does in Node. It would take a URL as a param. So much simpler if I could use exactly the same modules in both places. https://t.co/ZstmLfjMLr
